programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Atwater's reactions during a tense arrest are called into question; the team must dig in to uncover key evidence that could aid in the ongoing investigation and clear Atwater's name.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When actionable evidence finally surfaces against Sean O'Neal, Upton and the team work relentlessly to build a case in secret; they discover Sean is more elusive and dangerous than anticipated.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: To distract Intelligence from the investigation into his son, Chief O'Neal forces the team to handle a "dead fish" case; when that dead fish turns into a complicated heater case, Burgess is thrown back into difficult memories from her past.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: After a shocking discovery, the team begins closing in on Sean O'Neal with every shred of evidence they can find; determined to keep his son out of prison, Chief O'Neal hires a lawyer.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A series of brutal home invasion robberies finds the team paired with Detective Borkowski, an old friend of Ruzek's, to work the case; things get complicated for Torres when it becomes clear Borkowski has a vastly different policing style.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A shocking ambush at a funeral leads the team into a heated investigation to find the shooters; much to Atwater's surprise, he must rely on someone from his past to help in the investigation, dredging up old memories and revealing new truths.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An old flame of Nick's shows up. Although she's the one who cost him his job with the DEA, Nick is willing to let bygones be bygones, until he realizes that suspicious deaths seem to have followed her to Key Mariah.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick Slaughter, a disgraced former Canadian Mountie, and DEA Agent moves to the tropical island paradise of Key Mariah. Once there he starts his own Private Detective Agency, and meets Sylvie Girard, a local travel agent. Together they form a strong friendship and quite the detective team. However, the local police squad never make it easy for them luckily they have plenty of friends to help along the way. The Town of Key Mariah will never be the same again thanks to Nick Slaughter and company!

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman hires Nick and Sylvie to find her mother who abandoned her 20 years ago. They track her down to a clinic that offers psychiatric treatment, where Nick and Sylvie pose as a couple to join the therapy group.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A businessman hires Nick to protect him from his wife who he believes is trying to kill him.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A candidate for Governor hires Nick and Sylvie to investigate the accusations that his son raped a woman.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil makes rockets using antacid tablets and water; Phil uses chemistry to make light and instant crystals.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil conducts an egg drop experiment, with pumpkins.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we'll see the amazing strength of the leaf cutter ant. Find out how fast can a pronghorn really run, and how the desert camel is able to survive in such extreme conditions.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Siberian Tiger is the biggest cat in the World. It takes down large prey with its 5 inch long canine teeth. And the American badgers sharp front claws make it one of the best burrowers. Plus toads undergo one of the most amazing transformations!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Our planet is always evolving in ways we can hardly imagine. Take a look at the Earth's fascinating history, this week on Xploration Awesome Planet.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Every once in a while, we stumble upon a landscape that stands out from the rest. Join us this week as we explore just some of the many curiosities of our strange planet.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett takes part in a charity MMA fight while investigating a wealthy restaurateur's murder; NCIS Agent Kensi Blye examines a video of McGarrett's father.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The investigation into a plane crash reveals the customs agent on board was dead before takeoff; Danny cares for an orphaned dog.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The physically altered corpse of an unidentified man is found in the trunk of a stolen car; Danno crashes on McGarrett's couch.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett travels to North Korea with Jenna Kaye to deliver ransom to rebels holding her fiance hostage; the team investigates the murder of an investigative reporter who appears to have connections to Jenna.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and the team search for a missing bus full of school children and those responsible for the crime.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On the night before Chin Ho's wedding, the team's investigation into a man left to die in an abandoned bunker intersects with Capt. Fryer's case.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a teenager is murdered, the team must determine why she was targeted and if the person responsible was a hired professional.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Chin Ho shares news about Joe White that rocks McGarrett to his core; Danny is forced to play midwife when his ex goes into early labor.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Danno and his family are targeted by a vengeful dirty cop from Danno's past, the team steps in to help.

programme.title: Magnum
programme.desc: A guilt-ridden Magnum follows the clues his private investigator friend left behind when he was shot while working a case Thomas passed onto him; TC helps Kumu lead a protest against construction on a Hawaiian sacred site.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum, flooded with memories of his tour in Afghanistan, helps his fallen friend's brother search for a now-grown Afghan boy who may have been a victim of trafficking.

programme.title: Magnum
programme.desc: Magnum is called up from the reserves for a top-secret mission, but his friends are stunned when they learn that the mission is a lie and Magnum has been set up.

programme.title: Magnum
programme.desc: When Junior is kidnapped as leverage to retrieve the stolen list of undercover CIA agents, Tani and Quinn ask Magnum and Higgins for their help.

programme.title: Magnum
programme.desc: Magnum and T.C. go under cover as efficiency experts when a corporate manager is murdered and everyone in the office is a suspect; Rick is curious why Higgins faked an injury to prevent her from investigating the case with Thomas.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: When Jin learns that an innocent woman is the target of a deadly hit, he asks Magnum and Higgins to help save her.

programme.title: Magnum
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins must find Kumu when she's kidnapped by an injured man accused of killing his wife.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An insurance company hires Nick and Sylvie to investigate if the wife of a man recently found decapitated and the sole beneficiary of his life insurance, had something to do with it. Nick's friend Spider, the new Tropical Heat owner, is introduced.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: While on a case Nick is shot by a drug dealer, luckily a woman happens upon & takes him to her house to tend to his wounds. While he has survived the bullet wound, it turns out his savior is actually insane & imprisons! She plans on keeping him captive, so she has someone to love her forever! As time passes Sylvie and Spider, worry & Nick's safety & try to find him.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A rape victim hires Nick and Sylvie to track down the man who violated her, a serial rapist who marks all of his victims with a tattoo.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A man hires Nick to protect his daughter who's involved with a dangerous arms dealer. However, it turns out that she was sent undercover to get close to the guy by a group who wants to stop the arms dealer and his trade.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The burning body of an aspiring writer and director crash-lands onto a passing car; Bones seeks guidance on the meaning of passion in the workplace; Booth allows Aubrey to take the reins on their current case.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan testifies for Zach; Angela reveals some big news; Aubrey and Jessica come to terms about their future; when the team learns Kovac has escaped, Booth rushes to protect those he loves.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: After Brennan experiences a setback, the rest of the team must continue the hunt for Kovac without her, putting everything she has ever taught them to the test.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Skeletal remains found at the bottom of a lake turn out to be those of a congressman's former aide.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU investigates when a role-play session on a camming website turns violent after one user decides to meet his idol in person.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Carisi takes on a powerful judge when he inexplicably dismisses the rape case of a university student.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson teams up with Lt. Barek and the Bronx SVU to track down a serial rapist with victims in both boroughs.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson helps two sisters get closure from a harrowing childhood assault; Kat's cousin reaches out for help.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The squad rallies around Det. Stabler to find the suspect behind a threat to his family.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU must contend with an angry neighborhood watch group when a girl goes missing near a building that houses several sex offenders.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A high-profile activist suspects her sister has been kidnapped by a hate group; Garland and Benson push for change with NYPD brass; Kat gets some good news.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson walks into a hostage situation at a neighborhood restaurant; Rollins tries to help her father after he's hospitalized.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU searches for three women suspected of drugging and robbing wealthy men; the case leads to personal connections for both Benson and Kat.

programme.desc: The New Orleans EMT team treats patients suffering from a wide range of painful traumas, including a motorcycle accident victim in danger of losing a limb.

programme.title: Cajun Justice
programme.desc: A shrimp fisherman pulls in what he believes to be a human bone; "Funkie Nuts" intervenes when a Cajun and his nephew argue over crab traps; water patrol deputies search for a strange ball of light.

programme.title: Cajun Justice
programme.desc: Bayou neighbors fight over property lines; Sgt. Authement joins forces with the Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries to catch two alligator poachers in the act.

programme.title: Cajun Justice
programme.desc: An alligator hunter sets a trap for the thieves who have stolen his guns and are planning a return visit; an abandoned car is found off an eerie bayou road.

programme.title: Cajun Justice
programme.desc: An armed and dangerous fugitive from another parish hides out in the Terrebonne swamps; Deputy Thibodeaux shares a personal secret.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.desc: In collaboration with The Marshall Project. In-depth stories on criminal justice - including health care in prisons and jails, staff shortages and controversial forensic evidence.

programme.title: In Real Life
programme.desc: A global exploration of the true impact microplastics are having on our planet and our own personal health - and what scientists are doing to help fix the problem.

programme.title: Main & Wall
programme.desc: A drive into the intersection of Wall Street and Main Street, offering viewers an understanding of the news of the day through an economic lens and how it will impact their lives.

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase
programme.desc: Nine international adventurers, including veteran explorer, David Hempleman-Adams, follow in the footsteps of one of the greatest legends of the golden age of polar exploration - Ernest Shackleton.

programme.title: In Real Life
programme.desc: Join Nelufar Hedayat and Scripps News' "In Real Life" for an exploration of the multi-billion-dollar trade in trafficked artifacts.

programme.title: In Real Life
programme.desc: Artificial intelligence is set to change life and love as we know it. For In Real Life Correspondent Cody LaGrow explores why some people are seeking a fling with the new frontier - all while exploring a robot romance of his own.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Siamang is no ordinary ape, its arms are longer than its legs and can swing 30 feet in a single bound! And the male wood duck is one of the most colorful creatures on Earth. Wonder why? The Tamandua uses a secret weapon to slurp up 10000 insects/day!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Creatures from the continent of South America; a jaguar's jaws' ability to crush bone; the growth of a Galapagos tortoise.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: In this episode, prehistoric reptiles lurk below and giant beasts roam the open plains. Join Phillipe ousteu as we explore diverse ecosystems on Xploration Awesome Planet.

programme.title: Good to Know
programme.desc: Discover inspirational stories, with real-life stories of everyday people who positively impact their communities.

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase
programme.desc: Nine scientists embark on a sailing journey to Antarctica. They demonstrate what it means to live and work under relentless conditions.

programme.title: The Race - Weekend
programme.desc: A weekly look at the American political scene featuring Scripps News' political team and reporters from Politico delivering insight and analysis.

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase
programme.desc: Four women find purpose carrying babies for strangers in the conservative heartland of Boise, Idaho - the unregulated and unofficial `surrogacy capital' of the United States - and encounter unexpected complexities along the way.

programme.title: Scripps News Investigates
programme.desc: A months-long investigation into members of the national guard being denied medical care for injuries sustained in the line of duty; a look at the surprisingly high number of bridge strikes happening in the US and why so many bridges.

programme.title: In Real Life
programme.desc: Join Nelufar Hedayat and Scripps News' "In Real Life" for an exploration of the multi-billion-dollar trade in trafficked artifacts.

programme.title: In Real Life
programme.desc: A shifting climate is changing where wine grapes can grow, and conditions are ripe for Wisconsin to become the new wine country.

programme.title: In Real Life
programme.desc: A global exploration of the true impact microplastics are having on our planet and our own personal health - and what scientists are doing to help fix the problem.

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase
programme.desc: Suburban parents become unlikely advocates for cannabis criminal justice reform after their own son faces ten years to life in prison for a non-violent drug charge.

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase
programme.desc: This Scripps News documentary shows stories of loss and hope from those on the frontlines of a sea change already reshaping our world.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Melanie McGuire made a living bringing life into the world as a fertility clinic nurse; the police accused her of shooting her husband, dismembering his body and disposing of it in suitcases dumped into the Chesapeake Bay.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Rutgers freshman Tyler Clementi and Dharun Ravi had only been roommates for few weeks when Ravi decided to secretly film Tyler kissing another man; soon after, Clementi took his own life and Ravi faced surprising criminal charges.

programme.title: In Real Life
programme.desc: What can be done to curb an epidemic of cyber bullying targeting LGBTQ youth?

programme.title: Clebrating Hispanic Heritage Month
programme.desc: Scripps News celebrates Hispanic Heritage Month by sharing stories and interviews about Hispanic and Latino culture across the country, celebrating accomplishments and dig into challenges facing this community.

programme.title: In Real Life
programme.desc: Independent voters discuss a range of issues, including inflation, immigration, and abortion. Correspondent Gianna Toboni spends time with voters in their daily lives to see how the major issues are impacting them on a personal level.

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase
programme.desc: Scripps News, in partnership with Marie Claire, follows the women competing for a spot on the first-ever U.S. Olympic surf team.

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase
programme.desc: A quiet crisis has left millions of American women without much-needed maternal health care, as shifting resources and populations have led to the closure of hospitals and maternity wards nationwide.

programme.title: Journey Into Another World
programme.desc: Join the OSIRIS-REx mission to land on an asteroid, collect a sample and return to earth.

programme.title: Scripps News Investigates
programme.desc: Scripps News Investigates shines a light on abuse of power, corruption, and injustice through cutting-edge data analysis and human-centered storytelling.

programme.title: Going Global
programme.desc: Follow Odell Beckham Jr.'s trip to Germany to spread America's Game internationally. OBJ hangs with Bayern Munich, his German fans, the Munich Cowboys, dives into German lederhosen and food culture. Odell then takes a trip to London, where he talks about his sudden fame on Sky Sports and has some fun on the pitch with F2Freestylers and KSI.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Indianapolis Colts and Jacksonville Jaguars battle in a London frenzy during Week 4 of the 2016 NFL season. programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: As a longtime promoter of tunnel rams, Freiburger is often asked about running a four-barrel carb vs dual quads on the tunnel ram; he answers with a setup for guys who are all about the look and presence of the tunnel ram.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek teams up with his brother Sean to convert a 1966 Oldsmobile F-85 from a wannabe drag racer into a timeless cruiser; it'll take more than a paint job to make this car street-able, as the guys discover the engine is keeping a horrible secret.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys convert their motorcycle-engine-powered '72 Honda Z600 coupe named Bozo into a micro sprint-inspired dirt-track ripper; pro driver Taylor Reimer sets the bar in her 400-hp 1,000-plus-pound Toyota.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Discovering how a wet system stacks up against a dry system in an EFI manifold.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Multipoint EFI gets its turn against the venerable Dominator; it's injectors versus jets, dry flow versus wet, and drivability versus horsepower.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Fitment issues in the engine bay leave the entire shop scratching their heads; Joe has big plans for the '65 Nova, but a small space to work with.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets déjà vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Record producer and radio personality DJ Khaled wants Will to take a new Jeep Wrangler and make it the most unique ride ever.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Of all the different years and generations of the VW Bug, there is one that stands out among the rest -- the Hebmüller; there are maybe 200 of them left, so in addition to being hard to find, they are truly the holy grail of VWs.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The build continues, and the challenge is to keep what makes the car a Hebmueller intact, while taking bold steps to turn it into a hot rod. Dave keeps the traditional two-tone exterior, but modifying it to an automatic is a huge test for the shop.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Amanda and Shag stumble upon a '73 Vega with a rich history and a seller anxious to see his car restored to glory; they plan to chop the top and add a enormous engine, but first they must tackle over 40 years of rust and grime.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Looking into what happens if a Cummins diesel engine is put into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo; a customer wants Wide Open Garage to turn an old, rusted Chevy truck into a lifted, all-terrain truck on huge 74-inch tires.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: A camshaft is causing issues, so the crew explores how changes to cam timing can help tune a power curve for high-end performance or low-end power.

programme.title: Dirt Every Day
programme.desc: Fred Williams and Dave Chappelle pick up a military Unimog in Indiana with a few days to get it to Memphis for a big truck show; it isn't the on-road dream machine they were hoping for, so they shift the Mercedes into low range to see what it can do.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Normally when Kindig-It Design attends a car show, their cars are the ones being judged. But this time around, Dave and Kev hold the keys and will have to select the top 10 builders out of the hundreds of cars that arrive for the show.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A time capsule rolls into the shop in the form of a 1983 Silverado with exactly 69.2 miles on it; the owner recently passed away, and his daughter wants to finish turning his truck into a modern muscle car under the hood.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An abandoned 1967 C10 that has been sitting for years has been sold to a client who wants a few new touches, but closer inspection reveals more work is needed.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike reveal what it's really like to work at HOT ROD Magazine; they give the behind-the-scenes dirt on how they pull everything off.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The '56 Chevy Field Car gets ready for the drag strip.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Newbern, Cotten, and Finnegan participate in an unusual race that requires their boat to survive the competitors' attacks on a dirt track.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: This time around, Freiburger and Finnegan travel to Santa Rosa, Calif., to drive a crazy '74 Mazda REPU mini-truck all the way back to SoCal, where they'll compete in Optima's Search for the Ultimate Street Car Challenge.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: After more than three years of planning, the "Roadkill" guys finally transform a 1970 Chevrolet Monte Carlo into a beast called the Nascarlo.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's the mullet-car showdown, a battle of dirt-cheap beaters: an SN95 Mustang V-6 and a third-gen Camaro with a 305 that's so gutless it might as well be a V-6.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Freiburger take on a 1950 Ford F6 dump truck, shorten the wheelbase, add a supercharged big-block Chevy with a Gearstar 4L80E transmission, and a V-drive from a boat.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: People love it when the crew rescues old cars from the junkyard; they literally hack a '56 Buick Century out of a thorn bush it's been sitting in for 25 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A 1991 Cadillac Brougham is converted into the swingin' Broughammer with a Cummins turbodiesel; with special guests Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa of "Hot Rod Garage."

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich tune up the supercharged big block in the '69 Crusher Impala at Westech's dyno before hitting the road and the dragstrip. The guys run the Impala's fastest time in the quarter mile, but discover some new Roadkill-level issues.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich and Wiley Stevens up the cam game on the Off-Road Challenger, while also seeing if Wiley's '06 Subaru can be made into a rally-capable daily driver with suspension and airflow upgrades.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freibuger and Dulcich can't pass up buying a '41 Ford former race car that last saw action in some road races back in the late '90s; with tuning, a carburetor rebuild, exhaust modifications and some love, the guys get the Ford back on the open road.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Wiley Stevens and Chris Birdsong join Dulcich to bring new life to the car with a shifter upgrade, new clutch and a near-full rear quarter panel replacement.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Newbern and Cotten surprise Finnegan with a 2.3L 1980 Pinto wagon and drift lessons from pro Formula Drift driver Federico Sceriffo; they add a 396ci stroker engine and suspension mods before taking on a 1,000-plus-hp Ferrari 599 GTB.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Roadkill survived 50 episodes and in that time, we've built a whole lot of cars; in this episode we've got a shootout of the 10 that are still running and driving.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich give some much-needed love to the '69 Chevy Crusher Impala by way of a new 9-inch rear and a suspension overhaul. They also fix a major throttle issue that unlocks the 498 big block before hitting the road for monster burnouts.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich hit the road in a '66 Chevy Chevelle purchased sight unseen in an attempt to score two new project cars. The guys fix and tune their way from Washington to Arizona to rescue a dirt-cheap junkyard '75 Dodge Dart.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The LS-powered S-15 mini truck gets a revamp when the guys fix what didn't work from the last time they raced Randy Pobst around a road course in a Shelby GT350.

Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. Since Kelly saved the life of Chief Gall (John Russell) years before, the chief promises to free him if Kelly treats wounded Arapaho maiden Wahleeah (Andra Martin). Soon Kelly and the recovered Wahleeah are caught between Towns' soldiers and the vengeful Sioux.

John Fremont (Dana Andrews). On the journey, Caron and Fremont clash several times over leadership -- and the attentions of Dolores Murphy (Lynn Bari).

Joey and Fury form a special bond and embark upon lifetime adventures at the Broken Wheel Ranch!

While in Montana, he comes across a mining camp with a hanging tree and rescues a man named Rune (Ben Piazza) from the noose. With Rune as his servant, Frail decides to settle down, and he takes over as town doctor. He meets Elizabeth (Maria Schell), who is suffering from shock, and the two soon fall in love. But when Elizabeth is attacked, Frail's attempt to help her lands them both in trouble.

programme.title: Dallas

He fakes his own death in order to avoid arrest and to lull his enemies into a false sense of security. It turns out Hollister is gunning for the brothers who murdered his family during the war. Joining up with the newly arrived Marshal Martin Weatherby (Leif Erickson), Hollister heads for Dallas, where his targets are terrorizing the population with a crime spree.

However, the assignment strains Kearny's relationship with his wife, Erin (Phyllis Thaxter), after he chooses to continue the operation instead of searching for their runaway son.

programme.desc: Suzanne and Nick go out with another couple, but the double date soon fizzles when an accusation flies.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Former child star Todd Bridges guides Lindsey on a wild odyssey to teach her the dangers of drug use.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Suzanne insists that everyone in the family tell the truth at all times after she catches Nick in a lie.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Suzanne's book group and Nick's boxing-match party collide in the family room on the same night, resulting in knock-out clashing.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Suzanne suspects that Nick may have fathered his ex-flame's son. Ice Cube and Kandi Burruss guest star.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Kevin's burgeoning career as a child actor has a negative fallout when a potential big break goes to his head. Ted Lange guest stars.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Nick secretly plans a surprise for Suzanne to help her overcome a traumatic childhood experience.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Suzanne and Marilyn convene for a spa weekend for Mother's Day, but friction soon mounts between the two.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Lindsey decides to take on a vegan diet and lifestyle, but she may have ulterior motives in doing so.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Nick tries to give his family the best vacation ever but things do not go well at all.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Lindsey steals sixty dollars from Gigi's wallet and turns back around and blames Kevin for it.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Kevin and Nick goes to an R-rated movie, but Kevin has nightmares from seeing it.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?

programme.desc: Comedian and viral social media sensation Leah Rudick delves into marriage, family psychics, and anxiety attacks in the Cracker Barrel.

programme.title: Sinbad: Make Me Wanna Holla
programme.desc: A stand-up special covering the everything from the life advice his parents gave him to people with no talent having clothing lines and more.

programme.desc: Eddie Griffin brings his blunt and undeniable style to this stand-up set about athletes and racial stereotypes, relationships, and human mistakes.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: You Can Tell 'Em I Said It

programme.title: Jenny McCarthy's Dirty, Sexy, Funny
programme.desc: Jenny McCarthy’s brand of naughty comedy gets a boost from popular female comedians, including Tiffany Haddish, on the realities of being a woman.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Breakin' Out the Park
programme.desc: In this brutally honest stand-up performance, comedian Gary Owen confesses his hilarious history of growing up in and around trailer parks.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.desc: The comic performs in St. Louis, discussing Christmas as a child, feeling guilty on Mother's Day, Thanksgiving and Disneyland.

programme.desc: The ventriloquist comedian provides fresh, hilarious material with his favorite puppets; Walter, Peanut, and two brand new characters.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at Swallows Rest in Weymouth, Dorset, where owners Jane and Keith Smith are pulling out all the stops to win, but some of the feedback leaves Jane white as a sheet.

programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Burley Inn in The New Forest, where newlyweds Darren and James welcome guests.

programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The final home cooks compete for the last 9 aprons to fill the final spots of the field of 24 competing for the Master Chef title.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the first mystery box challenge of the season the top 24 must cook one dish featuring an ingredient unique to each of their home states.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining junior chefs compete for the final 12 spots in the Top 20. Making dishes ranging from cupcakes, to steak and lobster, the young chefs are tested to their limits and will find out if they will move on to the next round.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 20 face the season’s first mystery box challenge, during which they must cook dishes using both sweet and savory ingredients. Later in the MASTERCHEF kitchen, the contestants must replicate Chef Ramsay’s signature hand-roasted sea bass. Then, it’s up to the judges to decide who stays and who goes home.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay makes the trek to Carlstadt, New Jersey to visit Grasshopper Also, an eatery that has seen better days.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Traveling to Boston's North End, Chef Ramsay spends a week at Davide, an Italian eatery mismanaged by feuding brothers.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The remaining contestants must match side dishes with four different types of protein. The winners spend a day at Laguna Beach while the losers prep honey taffy from scratch.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Forgoing a challenge this episode, Chef Ramsay asks both teams to choose a captain for the dinner service, testing the aspiring chefs' communication, cooperation and leadership skills.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The final home cooks compete for the last 9 aprons to fill the final spots of the field of 24 competing for the Master Chef title.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the first mystery box challenge of the season the top 24 must cook one dish featuring an ingredient unique to each of their home states.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 18 return to the kitchen to face off in two challenges. In the first competition, the young cooks are split into teams and have 10 minutes to make a classic American dish – the corn dog. The winning team gets to turn the judges into a yummy treat. Later in the MASTERCHEF kitchen, the contestants have to make a juicy burger, but there’s a tough catch! Then, it’s up to the judges to decide who stays and who goes home.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 16 face off in their first team challenge, during which they cook lunch for first responders. Each team will have to create a dish featuring a delicious filet mignon and the guests will vote on which is better – the team with the most votes will win the challenge. Then, it’s up to the judges to determine which two cooks from the losing team will head home.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to Providence, Rhode Island to visit DownCity, a downtrodden eatery held back by a stubborn, short-tempered owner.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay returns to Lido di Manhattan, Anna Vincenzo's and Le Bistro to see if the owners have implemented his changes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The teams cook gourmet pizza that will be judged by Chef Ramsay and Wolfgang Puck. The winners spend the day at a rooftop swimming pool and enjoy a session with a yoga instructor.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The teams cook sampler dishes for guests at an event honoring the 160th anniversary of the Phi Mu sorority. Each team must serve a chicken, seafood and beef entrée.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: This week, the remaining 16 home cooks get a very special treat leading into the next challenge, as Chef Ramsay demonstrates how to properly deconstruct a lobster.

programme.desc: The Top 20 chefs face the first team challenge of the season at the Anheuser Busch brewery.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S04:E09 - Episode 9

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S04:E10 - Episode 10

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is La Lanterna in Letchworth, Hertfordshire. Twenty-eight-year-old owner and head chef Alex offers modern Italian cuisine, a taste of Little Italy in England's first garden city, and the restaurant is run by his best mate maitre dé Gavin, helped by his ex-air hostess girlfriend Emily. But Alex has no customers, cookers that don't work and an expensive menu that's about as authentically Italian as a spag bol.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is D-Place in Chelmsford, Essex run by Mexican-born Israel and his English partner Tara. They've sunk ~£150,000 of their own money into their trendy café bar which offers a vast selection of fusion cuisine. In charge is Executive Chef Philippe, producing everything from all-day breakfasts to hoi sin noodles with an astounding lack of flair; the plastic food is dire and boomerangs back from the dining room as soon as it's cooked.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E05 - Food on a Budget

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E06 - Baking

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's third programme is Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater a stone's throw from Brighton's sea front. Big soul momma, owner Charita Jones, produces a menu of irresistibly unique classics from the Deep South. The food's hard to fault but the punters are nowhere to be seen, Head Chef Brian and a rag-tag collection of part-timers are taking the mickey - and despite working a seven-day week Charita's got an empty restaurant and a ~£65,000 debt.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's fourth programme is La Riviera, a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~£8000 a week to run, the place boasts top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff with Michelin star-studded backgrounds. Loic is on a mission, to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of haggis, tatties and deep-fried Mars bars. But though he's hungry for success, he's French, he's arrogant and the food's pretentious.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course for three of London and the South East's finest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Mark Froydenlund. Returning contender Matt is determined to bring home a 10 with his ambitious celebration of the billy goat but has he bitten off more than he can chew?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and the London and South East chefs are striving to secure one of the two spots in tomorrow's Regional Final. The scores are close, so it's all to play for, as today marks the end of the competition for one man.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and South East chefs are cooking all four courses again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by Mary Gwynn, author of the official WI centenary cookbook. Together they'll decide which chef goes through to represent the region in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the Central Region's finest chefs - Pip Lacey, Richard Bainbridge and Jason Hodnett - attempt to impress this week's veteran judge with their starters. With big boots to fill, Angela Hartnett's protégé Pip is the only newcomer in the kitchen. Will she beat the boys to claim victory?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three Central Region chefs - newcomer Pip Lacey, 4th time competitor Richard Bainbridge and returning chef Jason Hodnett - fight it out in the fish course. Pip is hoping to outclass her rivals with a smoked haddock dish inspired by her Grandma.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course with three Central Region chefs - Pip Lacey, Richard Bainbridge and Jason Hodnett. Once again Jason is taking risks with his unusual collection of ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Central Region chefs to impress, with the dessert course. Only two chefs can go through to cook for the judges so with everything to play for, who will plate up perfection and who will be sent packing?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Central Region chefs cook their entire menus again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They'll be joined by former chair of the Women's Institute Helen Carey, who will help decide who will have the glory of representing the region in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the starter course, and eight of the finest chefs in the country are battling it out to plate up impeccable dishes worthy of the Women's Institute. The judges are joined by WI Calendar Girl Angela Baker, but after Oliver reveals that this year it will be much tougher to make it onto the judge's shortlist, who will keep their cool and secure a place?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle for the fish course, and those chefs who didn't make it onto the shortlist with their starters are hoping to do better. The judges are joined by a WI president, Kristy Bowen, who knows the impeccable standards the Institute will expect.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's main course day, the half-way point in Finals Week, and those chefs who have yet to get a dish on the shortlist are feeling the heat. With only dishes judged to be perfect in with a chance at reaching the WI banquet, the standards are higher than ever before.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for dessert, and the last chance for the eight regional champions to get a dish in contention for the final banquet. Those who've failed to make the judges shortlist so far are going all out. Joining the judges is author of the WI centenary cookbook Mary Gwynn.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The banquet is finally here. It's the culmination of months of hard work as the winning chefs strive to plate up perfect dishes for the ladies of the Women's Institute, at London's historic Draper's Hall where pioneers of the WI once gathered.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. A dish celebrating childhood summer memories takes on a complicated courgette dish and a technically tricky take on the cucumber sandwich.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more intense as all the chefs take risks with their dishes. Mike Reid, executive chef at M Restaurants in London, shocks when he pairs his fish with some highly unusual flavours.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a smoke filled kitchen as the three chefs prepare their summer-themed mains in the hope of impressing the veteran judge. Selin Kiazim is in her element, cooking a feast inspired by the summer barbecues she enjoyed with her family.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are feeling the pressure as they attempt their technical summer desserts. With only the two highest scorers going through to the regional final, who will be sent home?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the South East chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs have been challenged to create outstanding dishes that capture a `taste of summer'. Their menus must reflect the tastes, smells and colours of everybody's favourite time of year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and, with a seafood specialist in the kitchen, the competition is stepping up a gear. Tom is hoping he'll be able to elevate the humble mackerel to the standards required for the Wimbledon banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are honouring Wimbledon and the British summer with their technically challenging strawberry desserts. Only the two highest scorers will go through to cook for the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs compete for a place in the national finals. To get there they'll have to impress the formidable panel of judges: Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tom Parker is eager to impress with a salad that includes 10 elements. Meanwhile, Paul Askew, hopes his traditional techniques will triumph over his younger competitors, and Ellis Barrie is taking a risk with a creative cucumber and oyster starter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen gets even tenser as the three newcomers begin to understand the perfection and skill the veteran chef demands. Ellis Barrie attempts to create the flavour of a summer barbecue.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and the pressure is intense in the kitchen. In the hope of impressing the veteran judge, Paul Askew is serving an extremely personal main course based on his mother's favourite food.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Paul can't afford to make any mistakes and is pushing himself with a technically challenging baked alaska.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining north west chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. The guest judge is Greg Rusedski, former British number one, who understands the high standards expected at Wimbledon.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning banquet champion Tommy Banks takes on two ambitious newcomers, Danny Parker and Josh Overington. They start by finding out whois the surprise veteran judge and who will be marking their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated, the three chefs are cooking their fish courses. Josh Overington creates a decadent dish inspired by the prestige of the Wimbledon Championships.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are cooking their main courses and are all taking risks to try and win a place at the banquet. Danny Parker is trying to recreate the flavours of an American barbecue but the veteran chef is dubious about one of his ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. All the chefs are using unusual ingredients in their desserts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs from the north east must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver, and guest Judy Murray.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Scottish regional heats and returning chefs to the competition Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath battle ambitious newcomer Angela Malik for a place in the national finals. This time they are cooking their starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated and the veteran chef is expecting perfection from the fish course. Ally McGrath creates an inventive dish based on his summer memories of rock pooling in the River Tweed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Angela Malik is in her element cooking a tiffin box based on memories of summer picnics. Michael Bremner is taking a huge risk, and Ally is creating an inventive dish based on a summer barbeque.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Angela Malik is cooking a technically challenging dessert.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two Scottish chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver. They are joined by guest judge Gary Parsons.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Determined newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie take on returning chef Phil Carmichael for a place in the national finals. It's Phil's third time in the competition and this year he's determined to make it to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses. Paul Croasdale is trying to recreate the elegance of Wimbledon with luxury ingredients such as king crab and scallops.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the main course, all three chefs are cooking Welsh lamb in the hope of impressing the judge. Phil is taking a risk with barbecued lamb and in an attempt to elevate a humble barbecue to banquet level, he's serving it with many accompaniments.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges so all three chefs are feeling the pressure. Phil Carmichael creates a tennis ball dessert that combines two British classics, Eton mess and trifle.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two winning chefs from the Wales region must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges and guest judge Dan Bloxham, Wimbledon's Master of Ceremonies.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Pip Lacey's starter is a humorous take on the unpredictable British weather and features an unusual presentation. Ryan Simpson's dish represents an allotment complete with soil, while Nick Deverell-Smith's creation is a tribute to the precision cutting of Wimbledon's grass.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With the chefs hoping to impress, they each take risks. Pip Lacey combines lobster with strawberry in a tribute to strawberries and cream. Ryan Simpson's also using lobster in his recreation of a BBQ and has invented a technique to create his chips.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ryan Simpson hopes to elevate a ploughman's lunch into a gourmet affair, Pip Lacey pays tribute to an unusual Wimbledon icon, while Nick Deverell-Smith looks to celebrate a meat which he thinks is underused, venison.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges. Pip Lacey's pineapple dessert uses coriander. Nick Deverell-Smith also pays tribute to the pineapple, creating a dessert featuring a rice pudding made with couscous.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who've made it through cook their four courses again. They must impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest judge Jordanne Whiley, one of Britain's most successful wheelchair tennis players.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. Eddie is hoping to do better than last year, Joery is hoping to impress with a tribute to Richard Krajicek, and Tommy is creating a warm salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Joery Castel is combining mackerel and cucumber, and Tommy Heaney hopes his Murray Mound is a fitting tribute to Andy Murray's love of sushi. Eddie Attwell is creating five different strawberry elements to accompany the scallops in his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who have made it through cook their four courses again. They are hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver, who are joined by tennis's greatest entertainer, Mansour Bahrami.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With finals week ahead of them, judge Andi Oliver first summons the chefs to Wimbledon to take a look at where they could be cooking if they win. The judges are joined by guest judge Sue Barker, host of the Wimbledon coverage for more than 20 years.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but with some exceptionally high scoring dishes in the regional heats, each chef will need to deliver perfection in order to see off the competition. The judges are joined by guest judge Tim Henman.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. As the barbecues are fired up, all eight chefs are feeling the heat. The judges are joined by guest judge Gordon Reid.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is dessert day and with just one place remaining at the Wimbledon banquet, each chef is giving everything they have got. The judges are joined by guest judge Annabel Croft, former British number one and Junior Wimbledon champion.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale and the winning chefs must now cook their dishes at the banquet. Once in the kitchen, the chefs face the huge challenge of scaling up their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Competing for top spot are Danny Parker, head chef at Michelin starred `House of Tides' in Newcastle, who is back to try his luck in the competition again after being knocked out in the regional heat last year following a tense tie-break. He's taking on two newcomers: Dan Fletcher, protégé of Phil Howard, and now head chef at `Fenchurch' in the City of London, and David Coulson,who runs `Peace and Loaf' in Newcastle, which boasts 2 AA rosettes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course the chefs are all aiming for 10s with their unique fish dishes. David is celebrating a personal connection to the brief with his `My Cod I Bet Me Ma'am Has Seen Some Trotters', a tribute to his mum who has worked as a chiropodist. Dan's `For All Those Sleepless Nights' pays tribute to nightshift workers from the NHS with some bold but classic flavours while Danny's `Not All Superheroes Wear Capes' aims to give a taste of luxury to the hardworking staff.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dan pays tribute to an icon of modern nursing, Florence Nightingale, while Danny is inspired by the founder of the NHS, Aneurin Bevan. David's dish is dedicated to the air ambulance staff who saved the life of his fiancé, and he even takes a trip to meet one of them.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the chefs' last chance to impress and tensions are high. Dan takes a risk with an unusual combination of ewe's milk and bergamot while Danny is determined to pull out all the stops with his complex dessert `Aunty Gwen's Chocolate'. David hopes to transform a childhood comfort classic into a show stopping dessert. Dan also takes a trip to meet Dr Ben Clarke who was working in the Royal London Hospital A&E during the London Bridge terror attack.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they serve their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Banquet champion Selin Kiazim, a rising star of the London scene renowned for her Turkish Cypriot fusion flavours, is back hoping to join the elite group of chefs who have made it to the banquet twice. She is up against James Cochran who's worked at some of London's toughest kitchens including 2 Michelin starred `The Ledbury' and Scott Goss from `The Twenty Six' in Tunbridge Wells, renowned for his use of local Kent ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs do battle for the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen is tense. Lobster is catch of the day for James whose dish is Caribbean-inspired. Scott is attempting to elevate a classic fish pie, dedicated to his mum who worked as a pharmacist in the NHS for 23 years. And Selin is taking a risk with a complex three-part fish dish featuring sardines, scallops and langoustines, as a nod to the purported health benefits of a Mediterranean diet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scott is showcasing rare-breed Tamworth pork to say thank you to the rare breed of people who work for the NHS. Selin is serving a complex duck dish using ingredients from all around the world to honour `Our Global NHS'. And James is presenting five cuts of goat cooked in five different ways, for his bold dish `Under The Knife'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Selin puts her own unique twist on tea and toast. James creates a decadent coconut parfait accompanied by mango puree filled doughnuts for his dessert `Tree of Life' inspired by the coconut palm tree, the NHS and both of their contributions to our health. Scott hopes his elevated gypsy tart `Honey Bee Good' will secure him a place in the final.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the south east chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they remake their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Vying to be crowned champion of Scotland are three newcomers to the GBM kitchen. Lorna McNee is a former Scottish Chef of the Year and is renowned for her technical precision, gained from working at two-Michelin-starred restaurant `Andrew Fairlie'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the chefs are all out to impress. The heat is increased as all three serve their unique takes on lobster. Ross seeks victory with his dish `Lobster Aid'. Lorna's `Live Well, Live Very Well' features only three elements.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Music-loving couple Paul and Victoria welcome Charlie and the Rich Brothers to their retro-styled home in Coventry. With an original Anderson shelter in place and its owners bursting with imagination, this space is ready for a creative makeover.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: Alan and his team of autists take on their biggest garden yet of a 95-foot jungle in south London owned by Zak and Eloise. The good news for the team is that they've got £10,000 to spend on the transformation.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Music-loving couple Paul and Victoria welcome Charlie and the Rich Brothers to their retro-styled home in Coventry. With an original Anderson shelter in place and its owners bursting with imagination, this space is ready for a creative makeover.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highlights from the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team look back at more floral highlights from the series, including alliums and auriculas, houseplants and creative containers, as well as the scented stars of the summer garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge that has become a focal point for the local community.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nation’s gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we traveled down to Jacksonville, Florida to meet up with longtime friend, GORUCK Co-founder, and former Special Forces Green Beret Jason McCarthy. When he’s not rucking to and from the GORUCK HQ, you can find him and his friends putting on grueling garage workouts that are the talk of the neighborhood. Huckberry and GORUCK go way back, we’ve shared plenty of good times, GORUCK Challenges, and (more than) a few beers along the way. Their military-grade lineup is designed to be taken to hell and back in the field. So whether you’re traveling the world or “embracing the suck” with a 30 LB plate in your rucksack, you can be sure your gear’s up to the challenge."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "For our second episode of Huckberry Homes, we set our sights on the Oregon coast and flew out to see our friends ‪@ben_moon‬ and Sophie Kuller. Tired of fixing up other people's houses, Ben decided to spend the last few years crafting his own house from the ground up, while getting help from his friends, Dad, and Sophie along the way. This one-of-a-kind home now serves as a gathering place for creatives and surfers alike, nestled between the forest and Oregon coast.On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.We would like to take a moment to acknowledge the Indigenous peoples who have stewarded the land on which this video was created. This area was the home to the Nestucca peoples and other coastal tribes until the mid-1800s when the population was decimated by diseases from settlers. Those who remained were coerced into a coastal reservation by the US government. Let us remember the histories and cultures that have shaped this land."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsen’s 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillary’s ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin’s history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement. That’s why we’re beyond stoked to kick off our Huckberry x The Explorers Club partnership—featuring the Land, Sea, and Space Collection from an exclusive Whiskey Peaks collab and a badass grand prize. Tune in now to watch a tour so exclusive, it’s almost like being inducted into the club itself (minus the secret handshake)."

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Our friend and host of DIRT, Josh Rosen, stopped by the Gear Lab to show us what he packed for our most recent DIRT episode in Alaska.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "Here at Huckberry, we believe that style isn’t defined solely by what you wear — it’s personified in your morning rituals, your bookshelves and music library, the furniture you choose to spend your waking hours in, and the gear closet that powers your passions and pursuits. Style doesn’t end with your closet, it sparks to life there.On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.For our first entry, we turned to Austin, Texas’ own Scott Ballew. Our good buddy, Scott, is a filmmaker and songwriter who owns a Bohemian bungalow in the heart of Austin’s first suburb. It’s a home now that serves as a creative incubator, gathering place, hideaway, recording studio -- and maybe, as a personal shrine of a man curated by the man himself."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we drove out the Texas Hill Country to see our good friend Cameron Duddy. When he’s not touring around the world with his band Midland, you can find him out on his ranch, deep in the heart of Texas. Cameron gave us the lay of the land, showing us everything from a creative oasis he calls an office, to the places he enjoys most with family and friends.

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Embracing passion. Devotion to craft. Never being in a rush. That’s the ethos of Mañana, a surf and apparel company based right here in Austin, Texas. Our friend and Mañana Founder Alec stopped by the Huckberry Gear Lab to show us some of the tools he uses everyday while hand shaping surfboards.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: This episode of Huckberry Homes brings us out to the Western Slope, just a few miles outside of Vail, Colorado to visit our longtime friend and collaborator Sinuhe Xavier. When he's not traveling the world shooting commercials and making short films, Xavier's at home in his quiet, perfectly appointed retreat deep in the Rockies here he's a three hour drive from Red Rock desert and a ten minute drive from some of the best snowboarding in the world. There was plenty of magic in Sinuhe's spot, from his BMW GS to his exploration of how his love for his son shaped the design and decoration of his pad.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we caught our good friend and photographer James Barkman out in the wild. He gave us a tour of his vintage ""Yellow Submarine"" inspired VW Van and broke down some of the modifications he has made to make this adventure bus feel more like home.

Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farm—it’s all on the menu.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, it’s conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The Texas Gulf Coast offers an array of opportunities to experience the outdoors. On this hunt, we learned not only about the incredible adventures that take place at Run-N-Gun, but also about a Texas based organization changing the lives of young people.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits The Rocky Creek Ranch with two long time supporters of TTHA, Blake Barnett and John Fink. programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.
